fields.name: Blood Meridian West
fields.description: A violent frontier where religious fraud meets true evil, witnessed by a pale child who carries no weapon in a land of endless violence.
fields.hidden_truth: All authority is performance, and the Judge is the ultimate performer who needs no costume but his terrible nakedness.

fields.name: The Kid
fields.description: A pale, thin child who stokes scullery fires and rides unarmed through violent lands. The perfect witness - present but powerless.
fields.physicality: pale and thin, wears a thin and ragged linen shirt
fields.origins: son of a drunken schoolmaster who quotes dead poets

fields.name: Judge Holden
fields.description: An enormous hairless man who enters tents and destroys faith with words. Serene and childlike in face, small in hands, infinite in malice.
fields.physicality: enormous, bald as a stone, no trace of beard, no brows or lashes, small hands
fields.mentality: serene and strangely childlike face, speaks with terrible eloquence
fields.origins: unknown, appears like a force of nature
fields.motivations: exposure of all pretense, destruction of false piety

fields.name: Reverend Green
fields.description: A fraudulent minister playing to full houses during two weeks of rain, exposed as illiterate and wanted by the law.
fields.mentality: memorized passages to fake piety he despises
fields.origins: fugitive from Tennessee, Kentucky, Mississippi, and Arkansas

fields.name: The Kid's Father
fields.description: A schoolmaster who lies in drink and quotes from poets whose names are now lost.
fields.mentality: lost in alcohol and forgotten poetry
fields.origins: once a schoolmaster, now a drunk
fields.motivations: escape through drink and dead words

fields.name: The Revival Tent
fields.description: A tent in Nacogdoches where the Reverend Green holds fraudulent revivals during two weeks of rain.
witnessed_events: The Judge's exposure of Reverend Green
fields.architecture: temporary tent structure with crateboard pulpit

fields.name: Nacogdoches
fields.description: A town with hellholes where fraudulent revivals occur during endless rain.
fields.architecture: town with various establishments including hellholes

fields.name: Republic of Fredonia
fields.description: A latterday republic through which the Kid rides toward Nacogdoches.

fields.name: Dark Woods
fields.description: Darker woods beyond the fields that harbor yet a few last wolves.

fields.name: The Judge's Oilcloth Slicker
fields.description: An oilcloth slicker worn by Judge Holden, protection against two weeks of rain.
fields.significance: Practical protection that makes the Judge's nakedness beneath more terrible

fields.name: The Judge's Hat
fields.description: A hat removed upon entering the tent, adjusted before destroying the reverend.
fields.significance: Symbol of false civility before unleashing truth

fields.name: The Kid's Ragged Shirt
fields.description: A thin and ragged linen shirt worn by the pale child.

fields.name: Papers of Divinity
fields.description: Documents the Reverend Green does not possess, proof of legitimate ministry.
fields.significance: Absent authority that exposes the fraud

fields.name: The Judge Exposes the Reverend
fields.description: Judge Holden enters the revival tent and systematically destroys Reverend Green's authority by revealing his illiteracy and criminal status.
fields.consequences: Complete destruction of religious authority, congregation sees truth

fields.name: Two Weeks of Rain
fields.description: Continuous rain that drives people into the revival tent seeking meaning.

fields.name: Judge Destroys Reverend's Authority
fields.background: The Judge enters and exposes the Reverend as illiterate fraud wanted by law

fields.name: The Kid Witnesses the Exposure
fields.background: The unarmed Kid stands at the back wall witnessing the destruction of false faith

fields.name: The Congregation Falls Silent
fields.background: The Judge's presence alone silences the entire tent

fields.name: Father's Drunken Poetry
fields.background: The Kid inherits nothing but dead words from a drunken schoolmaster father

fields.name: Reverend Wanted by Law
fields.background: Wanted in Tennessee, Kentucky, Mississippi, and Arkansas

fields.name: Completely Hairless
fields.description: No hair, beard, eyebrows, or eyelashes - smooth as stone.

fields.name: Unarmed Observer
fields.description: Carries no weapons in a violent land.
fields.social_effects: Marked as different, possibly weak or possibly above violence

fields.name: The Law
fields.description: Legal authority pursuing Reverend Green across four states.

fields.name: The Congregation
fields.description: People seeking meaning in rain-soaked Nacogdoches, drawn to false revival.

fields.name: The Endless Rain
fields.description: Two weeks of continuous rain driving people to seek false comfort.
fields.effects: Drives people indoors, creates atmosphere of desperation

fields.name: Hyperion Cantos
fields.description: A universe where the Hegemony of Man spans hundreds of worlds connected by farcasters, while the Time Tombs on Hyperion move backward through time bringing the Shrike.
fields.hidden_truth: The Core AIs manipulate humanity while the Shrike serves as both destroyer and savior across time.

resource_types.physical: ancient Earth artifacts like the Steinway

fields.degradation_vector: Time itself flows backward at the Tombs

fields.name: The Hegemony Consul
fields.description: A diplomat on the edge of known space, playing ancient music while waiting for apocalyptic news. Last representative of human authority on Hyperion.

fields.name: Meina Gladstone
fields.description: CEO of the Hegemony Senate, leader of hundreds of worlds, sender of fatline messages across the void.
fields.motivations: save humanity from the coming storm

fields.name: Ebony Spaceship
fields.description: The Consul's personal spacecraft, elegant and ancient, equipped with fatline receiver and housing a Steinway piano on its balcony.

fields.name: Hyperion
fields.description: A backwater planet at the edge of Hegemony space, home to the Time Tombs and the Shrike, where swamps teem with saurian life.
witnessed_events: The opening of the Time Tombs
fields.architecture: planet with swamps, forests, and mysterious structures

fields.name: Forest of Giants
fields.description: Massive gymnosperm forest on Hyperion where tesla trees grow hundreds of meters tall.

fields.name: Swamps Below
fields.description: Fetid swamplands beneath the Consul's ship where saurian creatures surge and bellow.

fields.name: Ancient Steinway Piano
fields.description: A well-maintained piano from Old Earth, centuries old, on which the Consul plays Rachmaninoff.
fields.significance: Connection to lost Earth culture, comfort in dark times

fields.name: Fatline Receiver
fields.description: Faster-than-light communication device that receives burst transmissions of decaying tachyons.
fields.significance: Only link to the wider Hegemony from isolated Hyperion

fields.name: Projection Pit
fields.description: Holographic display system with comfortable cushions for viewing messages.

fields.name: Diskey
fields.description: Data storage and playback device that blinks green when ready.
fields.significance: Contains the fatline message that changes everything

fields.name: Glass of Scotch
fields.description: Ancient Earth whisky, likely one of the last bottles in this sector.
fields.significance: Small comfort before receiving terrible news

fields.name: The Hegemony of Man
fields.description: Interstellar human government spanning hundreds of worlds connected by farcaster network.

fields.name: Consul of the Hegemony
fields.description: Diplomatic representative with special authority on frontier worlds.

fields.name: CEO of the Senate
fields.description: Supreme executive of the Hegemony government.
fields.authority: command of all Hegemony forces and resources

fields.name: Giant Gymnosperm
fields.description: Massive coniferous trees native to Hyperion, growing hundreds of meters tall.

fields.name: Carrion-Breed Saurian
fields.description: Large reptilian scavengers that hunt in packs on Hyperion.

fields.name: Carrion-Breed Pack
fields.description: Hunting pack of saurian scavengers that roam Hyperion's wilderness.

fields.name: Northern Thunderstorm
fields.description: Massive electrical storms that sweep across Hyperion's northern regions.

fields.name: Decaying Tachyons
fields.description: Faster-than-light particles used for fatline communication that decay rapidly.
fields.effects: enable FTL communication across vast distances

fields.name: Fatline System
fields.description: Faster-than-light communication network using tachyon bursts.

fields.name: Interdiction Field System
fields.description: Security system that prevents unauthorized access or departure.

fields.name: Piano Playing
fields.description: Skill in playing classical piano pieces from Old Earth.

fields.name: Reception of the Fatline Message
fields.description: The Consul receives an urgent faster-than-light communication from Meina Gladstone.
fields.consequences: Sets in motion the final pilgrimage to the Time Tombs

fields.name: Consul Serves Hegemony
fields.background: Diplomatic assignment to backwater Hyperion

fields.name: Gladstone Commands Consul
fields.background: CEO has ultimate authority over diplomatic corps

fields.name: Consul Plays Ancient Music
fields.background: Maintaining connection to lost Earth culture

fields.name: Saurians Hunt Below
fields.background: Packs of carrion-breeds roam the swamps

fields.name: Brawne Lamia
fields.description: Private investigator and pilgrim, daughter of Senator Byron Lamia, carrying a cybrid's consciousness.
fields.motivations: resurrect Johnny, solve the Shrike mystery

fields.name: Father Lenar Hoyt
fields.description: Catholic priest bearing cruciform parasites, suffering constant resurrection pain.
fields.motivations: find redemption or release from cruciform curse

fields.name: Colonel Fedmahn Kassad
fields.description: FORCE military commander haunted by visions of Moneta and destined to face the Shrike in combat.

fields.name: Sol Weintraub
fields.description: Scholar whose infant daughter Rachel ages backward due to the Shrike's time curse.

fields.name: Martin Silenus
fields.description: Ancient poet who has lived centuries, writing the Hyperion Cantos to summon the Shrike.
fields.mentality: mad poet obsessed with completing his work
fields.motivations: complete the Cantos, meet the Shrike

fields.name: Het Masteen
fields.description: Templar captain of the treeship Yggdrasill, devoted to preserving nature.

fields.name: The Time Tombs
fields.description: Ancient structures moving backward through time, home to the Shrike, surrounded by anti-entropic fields.

fields.name: Valley of the Time Tombs
fields.description: Desert valley containing the Time Tombs, where time flows strangely and the Shrike hunts.

fields.name: Camn System
fields.description: Military staging system where FORCE fleets gather.

fields.name: The Shrike Pilgrims
fields.description: Seven pilgrims chosen by lottery to journey to the Time Tombs, each with a request for the Shrike.

fields.name: Evacuation Fleet
fields.description: Hegemony fleet sent to evacuate Hyperion before the Ouster invasion.

fields.name: Ouster Migration Cluster
fields.description: Massive fleet of 4000+ Ouster ships approaching Hyperion, ranging from ramscouts to comet forts.

fields.name: FORCE Battle Fleet
fields.description: Full military space fleet with farcaster construction capability.

fields.name: Ouster
fields.description: Space-adapted humans who live in migration clusters, considered barbarians by the Hegemony.

fields.name: Templar
fields.description: Religious order devoted to preserving nature and treeships.
fields.characteristics: tall, robed, mystical connection to nature

fields.name: The Shrike
fields.description: Temporal predator made of chrome and blades, moving backward through time, granting wishes through death.

fields.name: Ramscout
fields.description: Single-person Ouster spacecraft for long-range scouting.

fields.name: Can City
fields.description: Massive cylindrical Ouster habitat ship housing thousands.

fields.name: Comet Fort
fields.description: Fortified comet converted into Ouster military base.

fields.name: Cruciform Parasite
fields.description: Cross-shaped organism that grants resurrection but causes constant pain.

fields.name: The Hyperion Cantos
fields.description: Epic poem being written by Martin Silenus that may summon or control the Shrike.

fields.name: FORCE
fields.description: Hegemony military organization responsible for defense against Ousters.

fields.name: WorldWeb
fields.description: Network of worlds connected by farcaster portals.

fields.name: FORCE Joint Chiefs
fields.description: Military high command planning defense against Ousters.

fields.name: Templar Brotherhood
fields.description: Religious order devoted to nature and treeships.

fields.name: Catholic Church
fields.description: Ancient Earth religion surviving in the far future.

fields.name: The Final Shrike Pilgrimage
fields.description: Seven pilgrims journey to the Time Tombs as war approaches.
fields.consequences: One wish granted, others die, future determined

fields.name: Ouster Invasion of Hyperion
fields.description: Massive Ouster fleet approaches to capture Hyperion and the Time Tombs.

fields.name: Hyperion Evacuation
fields.description: Hegemony attempts to evacuate civilians before Ouster arrival.

fields.name: Anti-Entropic Field
fields.description: Time flows backward around the Time Tombs.

fields.name: Merlin's Sickness
fields.description: Reverse aging caused by exposure to anti-entropic fields.

fields.name: Farcaster Network
fields.description: Instantaneous portal system connecting WorldWeb planets.

fields.name: Treeship Yggdrasill
fields.description: Living kilometer-tall tree modified as spacecraft.

fields.name: Pilgrims Journey Together
fields.background: Chosen by lottery for final pilgrimage

fields.name: Ousters Threaten Hegemony
fields.background: Barbarian invasion or strategic conquest

fields.name: Hoyt Bears Cruciform Curse
fields.background: Parasites grant immortality with constant pain

fields.name: Rachel Ages Backward
fields.background: Merlin's Sickness from Time Tomb exposure

fields.name: Silenus Writes Reality
fields.background: Epic poem may control or summon the Shrike

fields.name: Kassad Seeks Warrior Destiny
fields.background: Destined to face the Shrike in combat

fields.name: The Wager's Doomed Voyage
fields.description: A British naval expedition in the 1740s that ends in shipwreck, survival, mutiny, and competing narratives of truth.
fields.hidden_truth: There is no single truth in survival - only competing stories told by those who lived.

resource_types.ephemeral: promises of rescue and naval honor
resource_types.physical: salvaged ship materials and scarce food
resource_types.binding: naval law and chains of command

fields.degradation_vector: Authority dissolves when survival is at stake

fields.name: David Cheap
fields.description: First Lieutenant of the Centurion, a burly Scotsman fleeing debts and family disputes, who will later become the tyrannical captain of the wrecked Wager.
fields.physicality: burly build, protracted nose, intense eyes
fields.mentality: fleeing personal failures, seeking naval glory
fields.motivations: escape debts, gain fortune, maintain authority

fields.name: John Byron
fields.description: Young midshipman who will witness the disaster and later write his own account of events.
fields.motivations: survive and tell the true story

fields.name: George Anson
fields.description: Commodore commanding the entire squadron, ambitious leader of the expedition against Spanish treasure.

fields.name: John Bulkeley
fields.description: Gunner who will lead the mutiny against Cheap, practical survivor who documents everything.

fields.name: David Cheap's Brother
fields.description: Unnamed brother disputing inheritance with David Cheap back in Scotland.

fields.name: HMS Centurion
fields.description: The squadron's flagship, a 60-gun fourth-rate ship of the line commanded by Commodore Anson.

fields.name: HMS Wager
fields.description: Store ship that will wreck on a desolate island, becoming the site of survival and mutiny.

fields.name: Wager Island
fields.description: Desolate island off Patagonia where the Wager will wreck, site of desperate survival.

fields.name: Cape Horn
fields.description: Treacherous passage around South America where storms destroy ships.

fields.name: Spanish Main
fields.description: Spanish colonial waters where treasure galleons sail, the squadron's ultimate target.

fields.name: Sea Chest
fields.description: Personal storage container each sailor carries with their few possessions and secrets.

fields.name: Ship's Log
fields.description: Official record that will become evidence in courts martial and competing narratives.
fields.significance: Legal record and version of truth

fields.name: Naval Commission
fields.description: Official document granting rank and authority, becomes meaningless after wreck.

fields.name: Spanish Treasure
fields.description: The mythical wealth the squadron seeks, driving men to their doom.

fields.name: Royal Navy
fields.description: British naval force projecting power across the globe through discipline and violence.

fields.name: The Squadron
fields.description: Anson's expedition force sent to raid Spanish treasure ships.

fields.name: Cheap's Creditors
fields.description: Group of financial lenders pursuing David Cheap for unpaid debts in Scotland.

fields.name: The Wager's Crew
fields.description: Sailors who will endure shipwreck, starvation, and choose between loyalty and survival.

fields.name: The Mutineers
fields.description: Bulkeley's faction who will reject Cheap's authority after the wreck.

fields.name: The Loyalists
fields.description: Those who remain with Captain Cheap after the mutiny.

fields.name: First Lieutenant
fields.description: Second in command of a warship, executive officer.

fields.name: Commodore
fields.description: Senior captain commanding a squadron.

fields.name: Midshipman
fields.description: Junior officer in training, often young gentlemen.

fields.name: Gunner
fields.description: Warrant officer responsible for ship's artillery and powder.

fields.name: Hunger for Fame and Fortune
fields.description: Driving ambition that sends men to sea despite the dangers.

fields.name: Fear of Death
fields.description: Dread that haunts every sailor facing the sea's violence.

fields.name: Protracted Nose
fields.description: Distinctive facial feature of David Cheap.

fields.name: Squadron Departure
fields.description: Anson's squadron departs England for the Pacific to raid Spanish treasure.

fields.name: Inheritance Dispute
fields.description: David Cheap fights with his brother over family estate in Scotland.

fields.name: The Wager Shipwreck
fields.description: The Wager crashes on a desolate island off Patagonia during a storm.
fields.consequences: Beginning of survival horror and mutiny

fields.name: The Mutiny
fields.description: Bulkeley leads majority of survivors to reject Cheap's authority.
fields.consequences: Split into factions, competing survival attempts

fields.name: Cape Horn Storms
fields.description: Violent tempests that destroy ships attempting the passage.

fields.name: Scurvy
fields.description: Disease that ravages crews on long voyages, causing teeth to fall out and wounds to reopen.

fields.name: Articles of War
fields.description: Naval law governing conduct, with death as common punishment.

fields.name: Prize Law
fields.description: Rules governing capture and distribution of enemy treasure.

fields.name: Cheap Flees Debts
fields.background: Escapes to sea from financial and family troubles

fields.name: Byron Witnesses All
fields.background: Young midshipman observes and survives to tell the tale

fields.name: Bulkeley Leads Mutiny
fields.background: Rejects Cheap's authority after shipwreck

fields.name: Anson Commands Squadron
fields.background: Commodore's authority over the expedition

fields.name: Brothers Dispute Inheritance
fields.background: Family conflict over Scottish estate
